reviews.review: Jogo difícil, é bom mas só jogaria com os amigos.

Do not buy this sh/it
  First because you have to buy them and then you have to buy in-game characters
Secondly, bad updates with stupid photographers,  idiots who only care about money. There is no balance in any way between the killer and the survivors.
Third, the last update is a very bad update. They told the players something. When the update came out, they told us everything they told us. They did the opposite and all the perks of the survivors were sabotaged, so all the players became playing with the killer because it is better and easier
Game is pretty fun and intense sometimes when the killer is chasing you but I prefer playing as survivor if you want some action but killer is fun too just not scary when you are playing as one.

Takes a while to get used to, but great fun when you are. Most important thing to know is that you shouldn't try to "win" every match, especially early on. just try your best, cause there will be matches that are harder than others and in the end you can still get a lot of points even without winning.
Behaviour Interactive is the textbook example of everything that is wrong with the video game industry today.

Downfall of survivor mains

As someone who's played this game for many years I have witnessed the significant change to how strong the survivor to killer is, I get the game is to gain pips which doesn't always mean escape. But, All the most fun moments as a survivor is to escape. With killer perks becoming more and more powerful, Survivor perks just stay the same and hopeless. I run games with no perks sometimes because the play is almost the same. Consistent BM'ing from killers while face camping and tunneling with Hex: NOED and Hex: Devour hope it's hard to have fun

Schlechtestes Spiel der Welt

Warum?

1. Haben Sie lust 1000h zu spielen nur um halbwegs alle perks zu haben die es gibt? + Glück musst auch erstmal hoffen das du das Perk auch Kriegst was du auch haben willst musst halt glück haben das du es kriegst

2. Connection und Hitboxen wurden nicht zu ende programmiert, man trifft hits die man bei sich selbst sieht aber nicht getroffen werden z.b. Du Triffst und der Schrei von denn Survivor kommt und dann kommt erst die Palettes stun aber das spiel denkt sich ,, hmmm nööö Survivor haben mehr rechte als Killer"

3. Killer sind minimal schneller oder bei manchen szenario langsamer als wie Survivor, dafür gibt es eingentlich das Bluttrausch  system was einfach nicht Funktioniert. Eigentlich sollte das System machen wenn du lange einen Survivor verfolgst das der Killer eigentlich schneller macht ABER in der Zeit wo du denn verfolgst können die anderen die Generator machen wo du als Killer zum erstmal vielleicht denn Survivor down gebracht hast. Die Survivor können das Blutrausch system ganz einfach entgehen indem die einfach dich loppen wo du einfach denn Survivor aus denn augen verlirst oder dir eine pallet dir in denn weg legen und du MUSST die pallet zerstören und somit ist ALLES weg was du dir Davor aufgebaut hast

4. Dead hard Hass Perk aller Killer ... E . Ein Dash nachvorne aber hört sich nicht nach viel an oder? DOCH Weil die Währenddessen UNBESIEGBAR sind z.b. durch die Kettensäge, durch ein schuß, von bluttkotze juckt dich nicht, Durch Killer durch dashen und das JEDE 40sek es gibt perks die was dagegen machen können aber DADURCH muss ein perk slot verschwenden werden der mir helfen Könnte das spiel zu erleichtern wie Generator zu beschädigen aber ne kann ich nicht

5. SPIELER SELBST du siehst seid 5 Jahren Nichts anders als wie die gleichen 4 - 5 perks von Survivor und das fuckt ab, weil alle sind gleich... genrushen dich ( !Nür Neue! Generator in kurzer zeit zu repairen wie es geht) und t-baggen dich am exitgate und das ist meistens das schlimmste....

6 Rank System kann man nicht beschreiben ist  einfach nicht vorhanden in diesen Game. Neulinge gegen Pros die alles haben *facepalm*

7. Grinden wird hier Sehr Groß gespielt, wenn du nur ein Normaller Spieler sein willst der max. 2 Stunden spielst auf ein tag lohnt es sich nicht damit machst du vllt höchtenst 20lvl wenn es hoch kommt 

Nicht empfelens wert für Neuanfänger  wirst nur in der art gemobbt als neuer spieler

第一次玩屠夫的时候，被车队狠狠折磨了；第一次玩逃生者的时候，被屠皇摁着锤；第一次救人的时候，我不分国籍；刚开始玩这个游戏的时候整局下来，明知道自己一个都带不走，出去被嘲笑为loser的时候，依然没有守尸......
I will repay a hundred times what i have suffered.

[strike]I could write a huge wall of text how this game is poorly balanced and how many cheaters there are and so on but I'll sum this up in more convenient way :

1. As a beginner you are up for absolutely horrible experience, especially as survivor. Solo survivor is considered as worst experience possible even among more skilled players. This mostly because at first you need proper perks which require you to grind. Entire game progress is nothing but a grind for points. If you intend to grind know that it's a job for a killer because as survivor, you most likely will be getting 10 - 15k on average where as killer the numbers are 20 - 30k instead.

Bloodweb system is archaic and should be reworked entirely. Right now it's mostly randomized market where you get random perks as you level it up until you reach the point where you are spending your hard earned in-game currency in attempt to get a perk that your character needs the most ( each killer has it's own weakness so you need to mitigate it as much as possible by trying to equip the perk that helps, be it in chase or generator progression slow-down ) however due to the nature of randomness and the fact that bloodweb won't ''refresh'' until everything is taken out. There is a mechanic called entity which will ''help'' you by consuming items from the side of the random remaining perk so you can progress but this also might deny you a chance of getting the required perk if you don't start buying items towards it. The biggest issue of this entire system is it's randomness which only promotes more grind. Unless you equip 4 perks which help you gain more bloodpoints but likely don't help you at performing better in the game you should be ready to have your first 100 or 200 hours spent on acquiring the very basics. For comparison the same could be spend on AA or AAA game or other MP game where you will gain a significant progress, not the basic essentials.

2. As a beginner killer you will start off getting beginner survivors as opponents who will play poorly and un-organized, but that won't last for long. Soon you will be matched against enemies who are either more experienced, use smurfs, cheat or are in a stack ( playing survive with friends mode ). Your gameplay experience will drastically change as you will learn that it's impossible to deal with decent survivors without losing your generators very quickly. The ratio of one hooked survivor equals one or two generators completed will be common which means large pool of killers will not suit such pace. Enjoyed playing a killer from a movie but turns out he has been recently nerfed after a patch? There go your 200 hours. Either switch to another killer and spend another 100 hours learning the basics of it and getting proper perks but know that at any moment devs may decide to turn your new favorite character into garbage on a whim. Shorty speaking your experience and time spent in the game may be all for nothing at any moment. To sum up - you control or own nothing. Your game pace is at the mercy of developers of this game and opponent survivors who may or may not be bad or decide to end the match quicker ( granted they have plenty of options to finish all 5 generators in less than 5 minutes ).

This is a trap game. People who are lured into this game by the prospect of playing as iconic villains / monsters with a promise of being a hunter, others who are baited by streamers telling them the game is easy and fun - they are all victims of false advertisement. Only few manage to realize early enough what is this piece of software truly is and avoid spending any extra bucks - everybody else are stuck here with hopes that this game does finally die because developers are beyond any redemption or when something remotely decent comes out. If you are new and are thinking about buying this game - don't do that. As developers once said - go play Civilization or something similar instead.[/strike]


I usually don't change my mind but this time I believe it deserves a change for two major reasons. :

1. The recent update made grinding much more manageable and progress is now more reliable ( prestige doesn't take your hard-earned perks, you don't need to ''hunt'' desired perks anymore as they are now share-able between killers when you do prestige ). No more you need to spend those hours farming BPs and then gambling in blood web for a desired perk. While getting high level prestige will take absurd amount of time, it's not a mandatory anymore so in terms of time cost, it's all more affordable.

2. There's no mixed review to give. The reason why I'd go with mixed here is because there still is a problem with cheaters, some swf balance and perk changes may be 50 - 50. I feel it would be unfair to downvote the game at this moment so it gets and upvote instead.

To sum up this time at date of 5/8/2022 : There are improvements being made. Sure as beginner you may still suffer at start but know that you are more likely get a 50% win rate now with current MM and perk changes so if you are willing to endure the first 50 - 100 hours, it should improve by a lot later until you hit 500+ hours mark and crazy swfs start annoy you by a lot. When you get there, you'll have to learn how to deal with them until devs actually address them, but hopefully you will be experienced enough to take on this extra challenge on self.
